availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Legrand R. Figg, Sr. (Louisville, Kentucky, ice merchant, brick maker, and teamster)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, ice merchant, brick maker, and teamster. Kentucky native. Married to Maria Davis Figg in Fleming County, Kentucky, on April 30, 1848. Father of Fanny Figg and Legrand R. Figg, Jr. Ice merchant in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Louisville in 1860. Ice merchant in Louisville in 1861. Brick maker in Louisville in 1861. Teamster in Louisville in 1863. Ice merchant in Louisville in 1865.
